memberdef.name: draw_output_border_texture

briefdescription.para: Given a region in Weston's (top-left-origin) global co-ordinate space, translate it to the co-ordinate space used by GL for our output rendering.

detaileddescription.para: This requires shifting it into output co-ordinate space: translating for output offset within the global co-ordinate space, multiplying by output scale to get buffer rather than logical size.
Finally, if borders are drawn around the output, we translate the area to account for the border region around the outside, and add any damage if the borders have been redrawn.

parameterdescription.para: The output whose co-ordinate space we are after
The affected region in global co-ordinate space
Y-inverted quads in {x,y,w,h} order; caller must free
Number of quads (4x number of co-ordinates)
